entry.title: Manage multiple add on fields under one sales order items
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We would like to seek for your advice how to proceed with development.

In Manage Sales Order version 2 app, there is a requirement whereby in one sales order item, it is required to maintain lot no.1, lot qty.1, lot no.2, lot qty.3.... and etc. up to lot no.30.

For example:

Item 10: Product A = 1000kg

Lot no.1: A0001= 300kg

Lot no.2: A0002 = 500kg

Lot no.3: A0003 = 700kg

Lot no.4:A0004 = 500kg

total of lot qty will be equal to sales order line item qty

Ideally, we would like to create a table under Sales Order line item to create 1 to many relationship.

However, it seems not feasible.

Could we get advice how to proceed as we would like to avoid too many add-on fields in the Sales Order app?

Thank You.

Regards,

Chin Yee

entry.title: Report related to stock retained period.
entry.content:
Dear Commnity,
I'm in charge of preparing SAP Public Cloud project.

I want to check the how long has it been since we post goods receipt for material batch.
I'm able to check the final goods receipt date related to batch.
But I want to see the automatically calculate dates after goods receipt.
For example) I posted goods receipts for Material A and Batch 1 2025/11/01 and In the report side, I want to see the date 10 for Material A and Batch1

Is there any standard report function in the SAP Public cloud?

Kindly advise,
Best Regards

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Factoring Process without Dedicated Scope Item - App and Process Guida
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I have a question regarding the implementation of a factoring process in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

**Background:**
- Customer uses 2-party factoring (immediate payment type)
- Customer wants to use standard functionality WITHOUT the dedicated Factoring scope item (due to additional cost)
- Manual workaround using standard apps and postings is preferred

**Business Flow:**
1. Invoice issued to customer: ¥1,000,000 (accounts receivable created)
2. Factoring company purchases receivable: Cash received ¥900,000 (¥100,000 factoring fee)
3. Customer pays to our bank account: ¥1,000,000 (we hold this on behalf of factoring company)
4. We transfer to factoring company: ¥1,000,000

**Proposed Accounting Entries:**
1. AR creation (Feb 10):
DR: Accounts Receivable (Customer account) 1,000,000
CR: Revenue 1,000,000
→ App: Customer Invoicing (F-22 equivalent)

2. Factoring purchase & cash receipt (Mar 10):
DR: Bank 900,000
DR: Factoring fee expense 100,000
CR: Accounts Receivable (Customer account) 1,000,000
→ App: Manual Journal Entry (FB01 equivalent)?

3. Receipt from customer (Apr 15):
DR: Bank 1,000,000
CR: Deposits payable 1,000,000
→ App: Post Incoming Payments (F-28 equivalent)?

4. Payment to factoring company (Apr 16):
DR: Deposits payable 1,000,000
CR: Bank 1,000,000
→ App: Post Outgoing Payments (F-53 equivalent)?

5. Clearing of "Deposits payable"
→ App: Manual G/L Account Clearing (F1579)

**Questions:**
1. Is this flow technically feasible in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition? Additionally, are the App IDs I mentioned (F-22, FB01, F-28, F-53, F1579) correct for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, or should I use different apps?

2. Specifically, can we clear customer-specific AR (created via customer invoicing app) directly with a manual journal entry including the factoring fee difference as shown in entry 2?

3. If this approach is not possible, what alternative process would you recommend? Please include:
- Which apps to use (with App IDs if possible)
- Accounting entries for each step

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Best regards

entry.title: Cannot access F1273 as well as F6748(CBC)
entry.content:
Premise:
Two individuals, A and B, accessed the application, but only B was able to access it.
At this time, A has all the permissions that B has, and also has more permissions than B.
Additionally, no particular restrictions are set for each role.
The timing when the error began: During "Manage Business Role Changes After Upgrade," multiple business roles were viewing the same business role template, and only one was retained while the others were deleted. Users assigned to the deleted roles were reassigned to the remaining business role. This impact is affecting user A more than B.

Question
Some users cannot access CBC apps like  Automatic Account Determination (F1273) and Define Financial Statement Versions in Global Hierarchies (F6748).
Please tell me the possible causes and solutions.

entry.title: Standard PDF Output Capabilities for Japanese Statutory Reports in S/4HANA Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi Community,
We are implementing SAP S/4HANA Public Edition for a Japanese manufacturing company. Could you please advise if the following reports can be output as PDF using standard functionality (without custom development)?

1,Japanese Corporate Tax Form - Schedule 16 (別表16) - Fixed asset depreciation details for tax filing
2,Japanese Depreciable Assets Tax Return (償却資産税申告書) - Municipal tax filing for fixed assets
3,Customer Invoice - With Japanese format requirements
4,Payment Notice/Remittance Advice (支払通知書) - Vendor payment notification

For items 1 & 2, we understand these are Japan-specific statutory reports. Are there any:

Standard localizations available?
Recommended workarounds using standard output management?
SAP Document Compliance solutions that cover these?

Any insights would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Replication Mode in Communication Arrangement
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

i have a question regarding the replication model setting in the s4 Public Cloud. 

What does the Parameter Replication Mode "I - Initial Replication" in the Communication Arrangement( e.g. 0008 - Business Partner Replication) do ?

Does this also trigger a single "Initial Load" similiar to the App "Replicate by Replication Model" with mode "Initialization"

I did not find any specific information on the SAP Help.

Thanks in Advance

Simon

entry.title: How to add a new admin task to the Manage My Timesheet app
entry.content:
The user would like to know if it's possible to add a new admin charge-code/task to the SAP timesheets called "Down-time", or "Excess Capacity". 

As per the requestor they require a timesheet task that will have no impact (still treated as admin/unutilized).  However, this request will allow them to separate downtime from time spent on required admin activity.  


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Feasibility Check on DMS Integration Requirement
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We have received some integration-related requirements from our customer and would like your input regarding the feasibility and the best possible solution. The details are as follows:

Our customer is currently using Kissflow as an external workflow management tool, where they attach supporting documents such as PDFs, Excel files, etc. As part of our ongoing integration project between Kissflow and SAP, we would like to include the functionality to share these attachments through the integration and store them in SAP DMS.

Kindly confirm the feasibility of this requirement and suggest the recommended approach or any standard best practices to achieve this. Please let us know if you require any additional information or technical details from our end to proceed with the assessment.

Product: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

Thank you for your support.

entry.title: Release TR BC initial scope
entry.content:
Before releasing the TR "BC Initial Scope" configuration, I performed a consistency control, which generated a long list of warning messages, including:


Requests could not be read

No entries found. See long text.

No transport entries available for object FINSV_FICO_CURRC and type V.

Final Status of the B-Inp Session will be read; expect longer runtime

Subobject ANLAGENNR does not exist

Interval limit starts with a special character. Interval AUFTRAG INTERVAL

No transport entries available for object V_T8G30B and type V.

No transport entries available for object V_T8G41B and type V.

No transport entries available for object V_TB038 and type V.

No transport entries available for object V_TKA01_GD and type V.

No transport entries available for object V_TKA02 and type V.

No transport entries available for object V_TKA09_CL and type V.

 

Now,  The TR has the Status on "Request Has Dependencies": what means this?

I try also to execute the release and it’s appeared a pop-up with this text "The inserit will be lose if you continue".

What means this?

entry.title: Unable to delete unused material number ranges predelivered by SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition
entry.content:
Material Master – Number Range (object MATERIALNR)

  • Project Implications
    • Material numbering is a crucial project decision that must be defined early in the implementation lifecycle and is rarely changed subsequently
    • Organizations with a large legacy product library are often unwilling to migrate to alternate numbering for various reasons, but often to reduce organizational change impact of the new ERP system
    • They prefer to retain existing conventions, schemes & catalogs which may include content with purely numeric values with and without leading zeros, or and non-numeric values
    • We need to have full control over the configuration of the material type number ranges to satisfy customer requirements including the option to delete any or all existing ranges
  • Configuration
    • S/4 Public Cloud only includes two usable ranges, one internal (01), one external (02) - these are assigned to the provided material types
    • Additional ranges (numbers 03 to 0O) are limited in scope, not assigned to any existing material types, and cannot be deleted – their purpose is unclear

  • While CBC provides a mechanism to modify an existing or create a new range, we are unable to remove any of provided number ranges
  • There are a few configuration settings that increase the utility of the existing external ranges:
    • The flag "External assignment without check" helps to create materials that have a number as the first character; however, the material number cannot be comprised exclusively of numeric characters
    • Lexicographical indicator refers more to the storage of the numeric entries and implies that the external range include the numbers
  • Request
    • We are unable to create a material numbering environment that is fully external and allows entries that contain both only numeric as well as non-numeric characters
    • To this end, we seek to delete the existing ranges and recreate as necessary to allow a fully “open” material master number range

What is the rationale behind the predelivered number range intervals "03" to "0O" if they are not assigned to any material types? Can SAP delete these unwanted intervals using expert configuration as there is no option for us to delete these intervals?

Thank you,

Madhavan

entry.title: Issue with Automatic Payments
entry.content:
Problem Description
We are currently experiencing issues with the execution of automatic and single payments in SAP. Despite reviewing and adjusting the corresponding configuration, the problem persists. The only temporary solution has been to manually reassign the payable account to each vendor, which is not the expected system behavior, as it should follow the defined hierarchy and execute the payment automatically.

Error Details
When attempting to execute an automatic payment for company code 4802 (Molino San Gerardo) using bank BCOL/1645, the system displays the following error message:

“House bank BCOL/1645 is not assigned to G/L account 11101020 in company code 4802.”

Account 11101020 does not belong to company code 4802 and is not included in the configuration, as confirmed during the review.

This same behavior occurs in other company codes, where the system attempts to use accounts that are not correctly assigned, resulting in similar errors.

Analysis Performed
The following reviews and tests were conducted:

  • Bank G/L accounts: Verified that the G/L accounts assigned to banks for company code 4802 are correctly configured and do not include account 11101020
  • House bank to G/L account assignment: Confirmed that house bank BCOL/1645 is linked to the correct G/L account and not to 11101020.
  • Bank determination for payments: Reviewed the configuration of bank determination for payments, confirming that company code 4802 and house bank BCOL/1645 are correctly parameterized, with no assignment to account 11101020.
    • Search for company code 4802 and house bank BCOL/1645.
    • No assignment to account 11101020 was found.
  • Tests in other company codes: When replicating the process in other company codes, similar errors were obtained, indicating that the issue is not exclusive to one company code.

Temporary Solution Applied
To execute the payment, it is currently necessary to manually assign the bank data in the vendor master record before processing the payment. However, this procedure is not viable for daily operations, as it requires manual intervention for each invoice to be paid.

Additionally, the payment is executed but impacts the statement account instead of the outgoing payment account.It posts to the account ending in 10, whereas it should post to the one ending in 12.

Support Request
We kindly request your support in identifying and correcting the root cause of this behavior so that the system performs automatic payments correctly, following the defined configuration hierarchy and without requiring manual intervention for each invoice.

Your prompt response would be greatly appreciated, as we are about to begin the integration testing phase.

entry.title: Sales Order BOM - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I’m facing an issue with Order BOM explosion in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Here’s the scenario:

  • I have a material TG11.

  • A Material BOM for TG11 works fine — BOM explosion happens correctly in the sales order.

  • I created a specific Order BOM for a sales order using the Manage Order Bill of Material app with:

    • Usage: 5 – Sales and Distribution

    • Plant correctly maintained

    • BOM released and valid for the order date

  • I created a sales order with the item TG11, but the BOM explosion does not happen.

  • I ensured the item category is correct with the Product Master Data for TG11 which is ERLA and when it comes to sales order it is showing TAQ(Pric at header level).

  • I tried to edit the sales order but then couldn't delete the material since it was saying the item is order bill of material. Even if I try to add a new line item with the same material TG11 the BOM is not exploding.

Question:
What could be preventing the Order BOM from exploding in the sales order? Are there any additional configuration or steps required in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to make a sales order BOM explode correctly?

Thank you in advance for your guidance!

SAP S/4HANA SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition #SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales

entry.title: SAP TRM Daily Compounding Interest Calculation
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to use SAP TRM on public cloud to calculate daily compounding interest in the same way as my Excel model. In Excel, each day’s interest is calculated on the sum of the original principal plus all previously accrued (unpaid) interest, so the interest compounds daily. However, in SAP, I am getting different results—SAP seems to be calculating interest only on the original principal, not including the previous day’s accrued interest in the base.

Excel Calculation Logic:

  • Each day’s interest base: Principal + Previous Day’s Cumulative Interest
  • Formula: Base Interest = (Principal + Previous Day’s Int Cmpd Bal) × Rate × Days / 360
  • This means the interest compounds daily, and the interest amount grows slightly each day as it is calculated on a growing balance

Difference in SAP currently: Each day’s interest = Principal × Rate / 360 (Previous interest is not included in the base)

I want SAP to calculate daily interest so that each day’s interest is based on the sum of the principal plus all previously accrued interest (i.e., true daily compounding), matching my Excel model. The goal is for SAP to use the previous day’s cumulative balance as the new base for interest calculation.

  • Is there a way to configure SAP so that it compounds interest daily, using the previous day’s cumulative balance as the new base for interest calculation?
  • Are there specific settings, calculation methods, or configuration steps in SAP that need to be enabled or adjusted to achieve this?
  • Has anyone successfully set up daily compounding interest in SAP to match this Excel logic? If so, could you share the configuration steps or any tips?

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: How to Monitor Outstanding Liabilities (POs without Invoices) in S/4HANA Public Edition?
entry.content:
Hi Community,
We need to monitor outstanding liabilities in S/4HANA Public Edition.
Requirement:
Identify Purchase Orders that have not yet been invoiced, including:

PO issued, goods not yet received, invoice not received
PO issued, goods received (GR posted), invoice not received

Questions:

What is the standard Fiori app or report in S/4HANA Public Edition to monitor POs without invoices?
Can we see invoice status at the PO line item level?
Is there an embedded analytics view for "uninvoiced purchase orders"?

This is critical for month-end accrual estimation and AP reconciliation.
Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How to batch upload G/L accounts in S/4 Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We're searching the solution for batch uploading G/L accounts in S/4 Public Cloud Edition.

In this version, we can renumber G/L accounts by uploading file,  but cannot batch change the "Not used" flag.  Also, some accounts cannot be mapped, we need to create new one, there are more than 150 accounts needs to be newly created.

Is it possible to use some batch uploading function to create the G/L accounts collectively?

Thank you for your help in advance.

Best Regards,

Grace

entry.title: 处理发票的付款项目报错
entry.content:
处理发票的付款项目报错：没有发现有效的付款方式。

实际上已经在日记账凭证选择了付款方式H
